overview:
Tom Serres is CEO and co-founder of Rally, an online fundraising platform. He is one of country’s leading thinkers on social giving, the cause economy, and online fundraising.

Through Rally, Tom has helped millions of supports connect with nonprofits, charities, advocacy groups, political campaigns, school groups, and independent causes to raise awareness and money online.

This past April Tom received the Campaigns & Election’s Innovator Award for 2012. In 2009, Tom was also named a Rising Political Star by the organization and was awarded the title of “40 under 40” in 2009 by the New Leaders Council. He has appeared as a guest contributor on CNN, ABC News and Fox News and served as a panelist at the Personal Democracy Forum, the SXSW Interactive Conference, and the AMP Summit.

Rally received the awards for Best Online Fundraising Tool and Most Innovative Product of the Year at Campaigns & Elections 2012 Reed Awards. Rally, which is based in San Francisco, is backed by some of the first investors in Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and PayPal.
